metadata.dc:author: Castellanos Monedero, Jesús Javier
Mantrana del Valle, José María
Legaz Huidobro, María Luisa
Galindo Andugar, María Angeles
Rodríguez Pérez, Alvaro
metadata.dc:description: Intestinal ischemia is difficult to diagnose and can be caused by several etiologic processes. We report the case of a female patient with recurrent bowel ischemia due to small vessel thrombosis, which is caused by factor VIII, a procoagulant factor.
metadata.dc:title: Isquemia intestinal de repetición por el factor VIII.
[Recurrent intestinal ischemia due to factor VIII].
